en: This is Rich Kleinfeldt.
zh: 我是 Rich Kleinfeldt。

en: And this is Sarah Long with THE MAKING OF A NATION, a VOA Special English program about the history of the United States.
zh: 这里是美国之音慢速英语节目“建国史”的莎拉 · 朗。

en: Today, we tell about slavery, and how it affected the history of the United States.
zh: 今天，我们讲述奴隶制，以及它是如何影响美国历史的。

en: Slavery is one person controlling or owning another.
zh: 奴隶制是一个人控制或拥有另一个人。

en: Some history experts say it began following the development of farming about ten thousand years ago.
zh: 一些历史学家说，它是从大约一万年前农业的发展开始的。

en: People forced prisoners of war to work for them.
zh: 人们强迫战俘为他们工作。

en: Other slaves were criminals or people who could not re-pay money they owed.
zh: 其他奴隶是罪犯或无法偿还他们所欠款项的人。

en: Experts say the first known slaves existed in the Sumerian society of what is now Iraq more than five thousand years ago.
zh: 专家说，已知的第一批奴隶存在于五千多年前的苏美尔社会，现在的伊拉克。

en: Slavery also existed among people in China, India, Africa, the Middle East and the Americas.
zh: 奴隶制在中国、印度、非洲、中东和美洲也存在。

en: It expanded as trade and industry increased.
zh: 它随着贸易和工业的增长而扩大。

en: This increase created a demand for a labor force to produce goods for export.
zh: 这种增长创造了对生产出口商品的劳动力的需求。

en: Slaves did most of the work.
zh: 大部分工作都是奴隶做的。

en: Most ancient people thought of slavery as a natural condition that could happen to anyone at any time.
zh: 大多数古代人认为奴隶制是一种自然状态，任何人在任何时候都可能遭遇。

en: Few saw it as evil or unfair.
zh: 很少有人认为这是邪恶或不公平的。

en: In most cities, slaves could be freed by their owners and become citizens.
zh: 在大多数城市，奴隶可以被他们的主人解放并成为公民。

en: In later times, slaves provided the labor needed to produce products that were in demand.
zh: 后来，奴隶提供生产需求产品所需的劳动力。

en: Sugar was one of these products.
zh: 糖就是其中之一。

en: Italians established large sugar farms beginning around the twelfth century.
zh: 大约在十二世纪，意大利人建立了大型的糖农场。

en: They used slaves from Russia and other parts of Europe to do the work.
zh: 他们用来自俄罗斯和欧洲其他地区的奴隶来做这项工作。

en: By the year 1300, African blacks had begun to replace the Russian slaves.
zh: 到公元1300年，非洲黑人开始取代俄国奴隶。

en: They were bought or captured from North African Arabs, who used them as slaves for years.
zh: 他们是从北非阿拉伯人那里买来或抓来的，阿拉伯人把他们当奴隶使用了很多年。

en: By the 1500s, Spain and Portugal had American colonies.
zh: 到了16世纪，西班牙和葡萄牙有了美国的殖民地。

en: The Europeans made native Indians work in large farms and mines in the colonies.
zh: 欧洲人让土著印第安人在殖民地的大农场和矿场工作。

en: Most of the Indians died from European diseases and poor treatment.
zh: 大多数印第安人死于欧洲疾病和治疗不当。

en: So the Spanish and Portuguese began to bring in people from West Africa as slaves.
zh: 因此西班牙人和葡萄牙人开始从西非引进奴隶。

en: France, Britain and the Netherlands did the same in their American colonies.
zh: 法国、英国和荷兰在他们的美洲殖民地也做了同样的事情。

en: England's southern colonies in North America developed a farm economy that could not survive without slave labor.
zh: 英格兰在北美的南部殖民地发展了农业经济，没有奴隶劳动就无法生存。

en: Many slaves lived on large farms called plantations.
zh: 许多奴隶生活在被称为种植园的大农场里。

en: These large farms produced important crops traded by the colony, crops such as cotton and tobacco.
zh: 这些大型农场生产殖民地交易的重要作物，如棉花和烟草。

en: Each plantation was like a small village owned by one family.
zh: 每个种植园就像一个家庭拥有的小村庄。

en: That family lived in a large house, usually facing a river.
zh: 那家人住在一所大房子里，通常面对着一条河。

en: Many separate buildings were needed on a plantation.
zh: 种植园需要许多独立的建筑物。

en: For example, a building was needed for cooking.
zh: 例如，烹饪需要一个建筑物。

en: And buildings were needed for workers to produce goods such as furniture that were used on the plantation.
zh: 工人需要建筑物来生产种植园使用的家具等产品。

en: The plantation business was farming.
zh: 种植园的生意就是种植。

en: So there also were barns for animals and buildings for holding and drying crops.
zh: 因此也有牲畜的谷仓和用来存放和烘干农作物的建筑。

en: There was a house to smoke meat so could be kept safely.
zh: 有一所房子用来熏肉，这样就可以安全地保存。

en: And there was a place on the river from which goods were sent to England on ships.
zh: 河上有一个地方，货物从那里用船运往英国。

en: The plantation owner controlled the farm and saw that it earned money.
zh: 种植园主控制着农场，看到它在赚钱。

en: He supervised, fed and clothed the people living on it, including the slaves.
zh: 他监督、供养和给生活在这里的人们提供衣服，包括奴隶。

en: Big plantations might have two hundred slaves.
zh: 大种植园可能有200个奴隶。

en: They worked in the fields on crops that would be sold or eaten by the people who lived on the plantation.
zh: 他们在地里种植农作物，这些农作物将被种植园里的人们出售或食用。

en: They also raised animals for meat and milk.
zh: 他们还饲养动物来获取肉和奶。

en: Field slaves worked very long and hard.
zh: 农场奴隶工作时间很长，也很辛苦。

en: They worked each day from the time the sun rose until it set.
zh: 从日出到日落，他们每天都在工作。

en: Many of these slaves lived in extremely poor conditions in small houses with no heat or furniture.
zh: 许多奴隶生活在条件极其恶劣的小房子里，既没有暖气也没有家具。

en: Sometimes, five or ten people lived together in one room.
zh: 有时候，五到十个人住在一个房间里。

en: House slaves usually lived in the owner's house.
zh: 家奴通常住在主人的房子里。

en: They did the cooking and cleaning in the house.
zh: 他们在房子里做饭和打扫卫生。

en: House slaves worked fewer hours than field slaves, but were more closely supervised by the owner and his family.
zh: 家奴的工作时间比田奴少，但是受到主人及其家人更密切的监督。

en: Laws approved in the southern colonies made it illegal for slaves to marry, own property or earn their freedom.
zh: 南部殖民地通过的法律规定，奴隶结婚、拥有财产或获得自由是非法的。

en: These laws also did not permit slaves to be educated, or even to learn to read.
zh: 这些法律也不允许奴隶接受教育，甚至不允许他们学习阅读。

en: But some owners permitted their slaves to earn their freedom, or gave them money for good work.
zh: 但是一些奴隶主允许他们的奴隶获得自由，或者给他们钱让他们干好工作。

en: Other owners punished slaves to get them to work.
zh: 其他奴隶主惩罚奴隶，让他们去工作。

en: These punishments included beatings, withholding food and threatening to sell members of a slave's family.
zh: 这些惩罚包括殴打、扣留食物和威胁出售奴隶家庭成员。

en: Some plantation owners executed slaves suspected of serious crimes by hanging them or burning them alive.
zh: 一些种植园主处决了涉嫌严重罪行的奴隶，将他们吊死或活活烧死。

en: History experts say that people who were rich enough to own many slaves became leaders in their local areas.
zh: 历史专家说，那些有钱到可以拥有许多奴隶的人成为了当地的领袖。

en: They were members of the local governments.
zh: 他们是地方政府的成员。

en: They attended meetings of the legislatures in the capitals of their colonies usually two times a year.
zh: 他们通常一年参加两次在其殖民地首都举行的立法机构会议。

en: Slave owners had the time and the education to greatly influence political life in the southern colonies,
zh: 奴隶主有足够的时间和教育来影响南部殖民地的政治生活,

en: because the hard work on their farms was done by slaves.
zh: 因为他们农场的辛苦劳动是由奴隶完成的。

en: Today, most people in the world condemn slavery.
zh: 今天，世界上大多数人谴责奴隶制。

en: That was not true in the early years of the American nation.
zh: 在美利坚合众国的早期，情况并非如此。

en: Many Americans thought slavery was evil, but necessary.
zh: 许多美国人认为奴隶制是邪恶的，但却是必要的。

en: Yet owning slaves was common among the richer people in the early 1700s.
zh: 然而，在18世纪早期，拥有奴隶在富人中很普遍。

en: Many of the leaders in the colonies who fought for American independence owned slaves.
zh: 许多为美国独立而战的殖民地领导人都拥有奴隶。

en: This was true in the northern colonies as well as the southern ones.
zh: 在北方殖民地和南方殖民地都是如此。

en: One example is the famous American diplomat, inventor and businessman Benjamin Franklin.
zh: 一个例子是著名的美国外交官、发明家和商人本杰明·富兰克林。

en: He owned slaves for thirty years and sold them at his general store.
zh: 他拥有奴隶三十年，并在他的杂货店出售他们。

en: But his ideas about slavery changed during his long life.
zh: 但在他漫长的一生中，他对奴隶制的看法发生了变化。

en: Benjamin Franklin started the first schools to teach blacks and later argued for their freedom.
zh: 本杰明·富兰克林开办了第一批教授黑人的学校，后来又为他们的自由辩护。

en: Slavery did not become a force in the northern colonies mainly because of economic reasons.
zh: 奴隶制在北方殖民地并没有成为一种力量，主要是因为经济原因。

en: Cold weather and poor soil could not support such a farm economy as was found in the South.
zh: 寒冷的天气和贫瘠的土壤无法支撑南方的农业经济。

en: As a result, the North came to depend on manufacturing and trade.
zh: 因此，朝鲜开始依赖制造业和贸易。

en: Trade was the way colonists got the English goods they needed.
zh: 贸易是殖民者获得他们需要的英国商品的方式。

en: It was also the way to earn money by selling products found in the New World.
zh: 它也是通过销售在新大陆发现的产品来赚钱的方式。

en: New England became a center for such trade across the seas.
zh: 新英格兰成为这种跨海贸易的中心。

en: The people who lived there became shipbuilders so they could send the products to England.
zh: 住在那里的人成了造船工人，这样他们就可以把产品运到英国。

en: They used local wood to build the ships.
zh: 他们用当地的木材造船。

en: They also sold wood and wood products.
zh: 他们还出售木材和木制品。

en: They became businessmen carrying goods around the world.
zh: 他们成为商人，运送货物到世界各地。

en: The New England shipbuilding towns near the Atlantic Ocean grew quickly as a result.
zh: 因此，大西洋附近的新英格兰造船城镇迅速发展起来。

en: The largest of these towns was Boston, Massachusetts.
zh: 这些城镇中最大的是马萨诸塞州的波士顿。

en: By 1720, it had more than ten thousand people.
zh: 到了1720年，这里的人口已经超过了一万。

en: Only two towns in England were larger: London and Bristol.
zh: 在英格兰只有两个城镇比它大: 伦敦和布里斯托尔。

en: More than twenty-five percent of the men in Boston had invested in shipping or worked in it.
zh: 在波士顿，超过25% 的男性投资过航运业或者从事过航运业。

en: Ship captains and businessmen held most of the public offices.
zh: 船长和商人担任了大部分的公职。

en: The American colonies traded goods such as whale oil, ginger, iron, wood, and rum, an alcoholic drink made from sugarcane.
zh: 美洲殖民地交易鲸油、生姜、铁、木材和朗姆酒等商品，朗姆酒是一种由甘蔗制成的酒精饮料。

en: Ships carried these goods from the New England colonies to Africa.
zh: 船只把这些货物从新英格兰殖民地民兵运到非洲。

en: There, they were traded for African people.
zh: 在那里，他们被用来交换非洲人。

en: The Africans had been captured by enemy tribesmen and sold to African slave traders.
zh: 非洲人被敌方部落俘虏，卖给非洲奴隶贩子。

en: The New England boat captains would buy as many as they could put on their ships.
zh: 新英格兰的船长们会尽可能多地购买他们船上能装多少就装多少。

en: The conditions on these ships were very cruel.
zh: 这些船上的条件非常恶劣。

en: The Africans were put in so tightly they could hardly move.
zh: 非洲人被关得太紧，几乎动弹不得。

en: Some were chained.
zh: 有些人被锁住了。

en: Many killed themselves rather than live under such conditions.
zh: 许多人宁愿自杀也不愿在这样的条件下生活。

en: Others died of sicknesses they developed on the ship.
zh: 其他人死于他们在船上染上的疾病。

en: Yet many did survive the trip, and became slaves in the southern colonies, or in the Caribbean islands.
zh: 然而，许多人在这次旅行中幸存下来，并成为南部殖民地或加勒比海岛屿的奴隶。

en: Black slaves were needed to work on Caribbean sugar plantations.
zh: 黑奴需要在加勒比海的甘蔗种植园工作。

en: The southern American colonies needed them to work on the tobacco and rice plantations.
zh: 南美殖民地需要他们在烟草和水稻种植园工作。

en: By 1750, almost twenty-five percent of the total number of people in the American colonies were black slaves.
zh: 到1750年，美国殖民地几乎有25% 的人是黑奴。

en: From the 1500s to the 1800s, Europeans sent about twelve million black slaves from Africa to America.
zh: 从16世纪到19世纪，欧洲人将大约1200万黑奴从非洲送到美国。

en: Almost two million of them died on the way.
zh: 将近两百万人在途中死亡。

en: History experts say English ships carried the greatest number of Africans into slavery.
zh: 历史专家说，英国船只载着最多的非洲人沦为奴隶。

en: One slave ship captain came to hate what he was doing, and turned to religion.
zh: 一个奴隶船船长开始憎恨他所做的事情，转而信仰宗教。

en: His name was John Newton.
zh: 他叫约翰 · 牛顿。

en: He stopped taking part in slave trade and became a leader in the Anglican Church.
zh: 他停止参与奴隶贸易，成为英国国教的领袖。

en: He is famous for having written this song, "Amazing Grace".
zh: 他因为写了这首歌《奇异恩典》而出名。

en: This program was written by Nancy Steinbach and produced by Paul Thompson.
zh: 本节目由南希 · 斯坦巴赫撰写，保罗 · 汤普森制作。

en: This is Rich Kleinfeldt.
zh: 我是 Rich Kleinfeldt。

en: And this is Sarah Long.
zh: 这是 Sarah Long。
